moves.3. d4: Now transposes to French Defense, Advance Variation
moves.3... Nc6 4. Nf3 Bb4+: preparing to castle with check (gain of tempo)
moves.5. Bd2 Bxd2+ 6. Qxd2 Nge7 7. Bd3: a developing move in order to castle kingside
moves.8. Nc3: white changed his mind and prepares to castle queenside
moves.8... Nb4: in order to vacate the c6 square for the eN.
moves.9. a3 Nxd3+ 10. Qxd3 Nc6: and there goes the other N.
moves.11. O-O-O: castling long and preparing a pawn storm on the kingside.
moves.11... g6: preparing to stop the pawnstorm with a pawnstorm attack of his own on the same side.
moves.12. g4 Ne7: changing plans in midstream to reinforce the f5 square.
moves.13. h4: white has no idea on what is about to hit him.
moves.15. g5 Rf5 16. h5 Qf8: black has complete control of the f file now.
moves.17. Rh3: protecting the N and trying to control the h file.
moves.17... gxh5: this poisoned pawn cannot be taken.18.Rxh5 Rxf3 thus winning a piece for a pawn.
moves.18. Rdh1 Ng6: still a poisoned pawn because of the N fork.18. Rxh5 Nf4.
moves.19. Ne2 e5: with an indirect threat of capturing the wh. rook on h3.
moves.20. dxe5 c6: preventing the taking of the e5 with a check
moves.21. Rh1h2 Nxe5: capturing the pawn with an additional threat to the white queen.
moves.25. f3: Taking the bishop results in mate, as in 25.Qxh3 Rxe2 26.Qxh5 Qf4ch 27.Kd1 Qd2mate or 27.Kb1 Re1mate.
moves.25... Rh4 26. f4: white must be in zugzwang at this point.
moves.26... Bf5: attacking the w.q. with a hidden attack on c2.
moves.27. Qg3: white is trying to position for a kingside attack. he should have concentrated on defense, like 27. Qc3 or Qb3 which would have given him breathing room.
moves.27... Qc5: not so quaint trap on white.
moves.28... Rxh2: in order to remove the defence on e3.
moves.30. Kd1 Bg4: the b goes to defend h5. W resigned due to B preponderance of materials. 31.Q moves Qxe2ch 32.Qxe2 Bxe2ch. Kxe2 and black is a rook ahead.
